title: Tony Dungy refuses to share if he voted for Belichick, Kraft on Hall-of-Fame ballot
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tony Dungy, former Colts coach, declines to reveal his Hall of Fame votes for Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft.
Belichick and Kraft were not elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame's Class of 2026.
The Hall of Fame Class of 2026 will be announced during the NFL Honors event on Thursday in San Francisco.

title: ‘You changed my life’: Cory Durden’s Cinderella season continues with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cory Durden, former practice squad player, becomes key defensive lineman for New England Patriots under coach Mike Vrabel.
Durden joined the Patriots after being waived by the Giants, contributing 30 tackles and ranking 20th among NFL defensive linemen.
Durden played a significant postseason role with 13 quarterback pressures, preparing to face Seattle in Super Bowl LX.

title: Payton Pritchard thrives in return to bench as Celtics roll over Mavericks: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' Payton Pritchard returns to bench role, scores 26 points in 110-100 win over the Mavericks.
Jaylen Brown scores 33 points and grabs 11 rebounds, aiding Celtics' 32-18 season record.
Cooper Flagg, a Celtics fan, notched 36 points and nine rebounds for the Mavericks.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 4)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington's 89 Andrew Ford Way, a Cape Cod home built in 1947, sold for $720,000.
Boston's 1 Dalton St. #5503 condo high-rise, built in 2015, sold for $9,500,000.
Arlington's 39 Newport St. multi-unit, built in 1925, sold for $1,155,000.

title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manholes exploded on Newbury Street in Boston, prompting evacuations from Gloucester Street to Dartmouth Street.
Streets including Newbury and Dartmouth were closed Tuesday night due to manhole explosions caused by an electrical issue.
Boston Police and Fire Departments reported no injuries following the explosions and subsequent evacuations.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station fare gates have remained out of service since a major snowstorm hit Boston last week.
The storm, which occurred January 25-26, deposited 16-23 inches of snow in different Boston areas.
Keolis and Scheidt & Bachmann are evaluating snow impact on the $1.3 million gates to restore service.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the current Patriots team's mentality and adaptability compared to past dynasties.
Mike Vrabel acknowledges the differences between his team and previous Patriots' Super Bowl-winning squads.
Drake Maye leads the Patriots with MVP-caliber performances as they prepare for Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, pleaded guilty to five charges including forgery and identity fraud in Suffolk Superior Court.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years probation, ordered to pay over $9,000 in restitution, and undergo mental health treatment.
Hewitt posed as a student at three Boston high schools in 2022-2023, using aliases and creating fake documents.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools implements a partial hiring freeze due to a projected $53 million budget deficit this fiscal year.
The School Committee voted to close three schools by 2027, potentially resulting in up to 400 educator job cuts.
Increased health insurance, transportation, and special education costs are contributing to the district's financial shortfall.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell humorously recaps weekly meetings with SNL-style 'Weekend Updates' at coach Mike Vrabel's request.
Campbell entertained Celtics fans by flexing and chugging a beer during a game, gaining viral attention.
Despite injury setbacks, Campbell significantly improved the Patriots' offensive line, becoming a key player.
